question.questionText: Why do you think those terminals and the negative battery terminal are in the same state?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Terminals 1, 2 and 3 are connected to the negative battery terminal
Terminals 1, 2 and 3 are not separated from the negative battery terminal by a gap
Terminals 1, 2 and 3 are not connected to the positive battery terminal
Terminals 1, 2 and 3 are separated from the positive battery terminal by a gap

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: because bulbs are connected to the negative terminal of the battery
they are connected only to the negative side of the battery.
the terminals are on the same side as the negative side of the battery.
there is a gap, so the terminals are connected to the negative side of the battery.
the terminals are connedted to the negative terminal of the battery.
The voltage has the same electrical state between any two terminals.
